abstract.text: Creates a new video decoder that matches the codec type, format description, decoder specifications, and pixel buffer manager that you specify.

inlineContent.text: The codec type for the requested decoder.
An object that describes the video data.
A dictionary that contains video decoder specification values, which may be empty. See
for a list of keys to use.
If the parameter values aren’t compatible with the video decoder, this method fails with the error
The video decoder needs to retain the pixel buffer manager and use it to allocate and configure output pixel buffers.

abstract.text: Properties used to configure a VideoToolbox decompression session.
A Boolean value indicating whether VideoToolbox uses a hardware-accelerated video decoder, if available.
A Boolean value indicating whether to require hardware-accelerated decoding.
This framework provides a means for developers to create format readers, video decoders, and RAW processors for media that the system doesn’t natively support.
An error code that indicates the extension doesn’t support an aspect of the media.
A protocol that defines the requirements for a video decoder.
A protocol that defines a factory to create new video decoders for a codec type that the extension implements.
Creates a new video decoder factory.
Creates a new video decoder that matches the codec type, format description, decoder specifications, and pixel buffer manager that you specify.
Describes pixel buffer requirements and creates new pixel buffers.
A type you use to interact with video format descriptions.
Information about an error condition including a domain, a domain-specific error code, and application-specific information.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.

inlineContent.text: The codec type for the requested decoder.
An object that describes the video data.
A dictionary that contains video decoder specification values, which may be empty. See
for a list of keys to use.
An NSError describing the nature of any failure.
